These include a surge in financial transactions on computers in the World Trade Center on the morning of 9/11.', 'Well, with dancing Jews celebrating the collapse of both towers and Larry Silverstein, a Jewish-American real estate developer, who signed a 99-year-lease on the World Trade Center, including the Twin Towers, just six weeks before the 9/11 attacks. The lease agreement was finalised in July 2001, with attacks occurring on September 11th of that year. Silversteins company, Silverstein Properties, acquired the right to manage and operate the Twin Towers, as well as Four and Five World Trade Center, and a large amount of retail space. The agreement also included the right and obligation to rebuild the structures if they were destroyed. Larry Silverstein, fortuitously took out terrorism insurance just months before the 9/11 attacks. A similar situation to what happened to the Israel Stock Market shortly before the Hamas attack on October 7th where there was significant short-selling of Israeli Securities on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange (TASE).
